intro: Psychotria scabrida, commonly known as the rough psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant features elliptical, dark green leaves with a rough texture, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Psychotria scabrida is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks, contributing to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
